speaker: Viral image
vclaim: In an e-mail, Hillary Clinton says that she does not want Michelle Obama at the same events as she did.
date: stated on April 23, 2019 in a Facebook post:
title: No, WikiLeaks didn't post an e-mail showing Hillary Clinton was insulting Michelle Obama.
text: The 2008 democratic presidential elections were at times tense when Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama came forward to nominate their party. But have you criticized Michelle Obama eight years later during Clinton's failed bidding against Donald Trump? "Do we really need Michelle [the publisher] to be at the same events?" :: Read an article in Facebook published on 23 April. "Enough to get her stupid pimp to screw up the business." This [prosecutor] of brain voters needs to just vote already." The article states WikiLeaks and claims that Clinton made comments in an e-mail to her daughter, Chelsea Clinton, on 20 October 2016. This article was referred to as part of Facebook's efforts to combat false news and misleading information in its news broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) But searching the WikiLeaks archive from the e-mails that Hillary Clinton sent and received on a private e-mail server when she was the Secretary of State, we were unable to find the statement that Facebook attributed to her. The archive was last updated on February 2, 2018, according to Wikileaks. Facebook was published on January 11, 2021 in Facebook, Nancy Belusi, who was no longer the Speaker of the House of Representatives by Samantha Buterman: January 12, 2021, when we searched the WikiLeaks e-mail database of the United States National Democratic Committee, we were also unable to find the statement there. Nor have we been able to find the statement in a set of e-mails from the hacked novel of Clinton's campaign leader, John Bodista. Finally, our search for news stories on Clinton made such a statement about Michelle Obama. Between the issuance of hacked e-mails to the debate about Clinton using a private e-mail server while she was the Secretary of State, presidential hope was twice given wide media coverage when it came to Internet messages. It follows that such inflammatory comments about Michelle Obama would attract the attention of journalists. However, we did not find any credible reports that Clinton said anything like that. We're assessing this Facebook as pants on fire! Sharing the facts 2019-04-26 16:40:51 UTC PoliticsFact 1 1 7 PoliticsFact Rating: Pants on Fire Hillary Clinton stated in an e-mail that she did not want Michelle Obama in the same events as she did.
